page.title: 09GRANGE FARM
page.content: {GRANGE FARM}is near The Dene.It has been there for hundreds of years. It used to be called Home Farm.Mr Bean rents the farm from the National Coal Board which bought the land from the Consett Iron Company in 19 .It is 52-54 hectares.There are 102 beef cattle.They are sold at Hexham Mart for Â£700-900 each.A calf would cost Â£200.Hay is grown for animal food and bedding.The potato crop is sold at the gate.Casual labour is used during calving and hay-making when work can go on for 16 hours a day.From 1960-72 Mr Bean had a dairy herd, but there were labour problems, and later tried fattening lambs but dogs worried them. Eggs were sold too. He has equipment including grass cutters, potato planters and spinners and three tractors. One tractor bought in 1961 cost Â£ 613 would cost Â£11,000 now.
